dynamic_line: Hallo, reisendre.  What is it you want?

responses.text: I don't need anything, just gotta got.

dynamic_line: Hello again, how can I help you?

responses.text: I'm sorry, who are you again?
Do you mind if we just talk a bit?

dynamic_line: I'm a wanderer like you who found purpose and a home with the gods.  I'm not who I was, but somebody new.  A disciple of the truth to spread the word of the mighty.

responses.text: What are you a prophet of?

dynamic_line: That purpose is to serve the true lords of this world, and enter Valhalla on some coming day.  There I will not worry about the wandering dead, but see the might of battle and feast with those worthy.  Odin the Allfather will smile on me that day, and everyone I brought with me.

This is our holy henge devoted to the gods.  Here we stay between pillaging the ruins of the old world, perform our rites for divine favor, and feast in merriment.  We all help each other in these trying times, united in our divine strength and sharp blades.  I help guide our warriors in battle and feast.

responses.text: What are you guiding them toward?
How could I get in on this?
Enjoy yourself then, I have to go.

dynamic_line: Our leader should be around here somewhere, likely in their hall.  While I can teach you about our way, they're the ones who could let you join us.  Gudene vil det!

It seems likely you wouldn't know.  Before there was anything in the world, there was fires of Muspelhiem and the frigid ice of Niflheim.  When these two came together, the ice melted and became the first of the giants, Ymir.  As he slept, more giants sprung from his sweat and saliva.  From the melt came the cow Audhumla, who licked away the ice until she uncovered Buri, the first of the gods.  His children were Odin, Vili, and Ve; who slew Ymir to fashion the world from him.  They made the first people, Ask and Embla.  Odin fashioned all things which we see, but the destructive giants opposed and fought him; these undead which invaded the earth came from Hel as an army of the dead during Ragnarok.  As foretold in Vafthrúdnismál, Vidar and some of the younger generation of gods will create a new world.  Only then shall we undo <the_cataclysm>, and fashion the world anew.
